channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2024040676
item.description:
Report E-2024040676

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-LOGISTICS contacted ERTS regarding one punctured 55-gallon poly drum containing (UN1814) Exelerate TUFSOIL by a forklift accident. This resulted in an estimated 10-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 30’x8’ area. A Contractor used oil dry to clean-up the release and generated three drums of waste for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024040617
item.description:
Report E-2024040617

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged by a load shift and released approximately four (4) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel overpacked the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then utilized absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the release. All spent absorbents were placed in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal. All undamaged pails were overpacked in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024040620
item.description:
Report E-2024040620

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of adhesive was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. ES&H personnel began remediation by patching the hole of the damaged drum and placing it into one (1) overpack. The dry adhesive was scraped off the floor, then absorbents were placed on the impacted area. All spent absorbents, and adhesive were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040610
item.description:
Report E-2024040610

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN1993 Glycol Ether EB release from a 330-gallon poly tote while at the customer location. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a crack on the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred into a new poly tote and then provided to the customer. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbent pads. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum along with all spent absorbent pads. The waste removed from site pending disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024041332
item.description:
Report X-2024041332

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-22
  • City: PHARR
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 04/22/24 at approximatley 1030, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 234501 at the staion location in Pharr, TX, reporting a corrosive liquid spill. The shipment consisted of 4 glass bottles and 1 plastic bottle inside of a fiberboard box. Each glass bottle held 1 liter of corrosive liquid and the plastic bottle held approximately 6 ounces of the same liquid. 2 of the 4 glass bottles were discovered to have sustained damage to the body, resulting in spillage. The cause the damage is unknown. The damaged inner containers were placed in a salvage drum for disposal and the unharried inner containers were isolated and awaits pick-up by the customer.
